intro: Anthericum pusillum, commonly known as the small anthericum, is a rare and diminutive flowering plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the Araceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescence consisting of a spadix surrounded by a spathe. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wet meadows. Its leaves are narrow, strap-like, and often form a rosette near the ground. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Anthericum pusillum is considered a vulnerable species in many regions.
